hm i mean when i read it..., that's what i read though
OP said Meddler wanted to buff every ADC to Vayne level. Meddler said that OP's being stupid and giving two of the weakest ADCs slight buffs is not "buffing every ADC to Vayne level."
Really? Because I got the exact opposite impression. I figured they'd be buffing other ADCs in the early game so that they can punish Vayne in lane, which is part of the problem right now.

He didn't even state that they are getting buffs. He just implied that as a result of them looking at how strong vayne is there is a possibility that they come to one of many conclusions or maybe multiple.

1. (he implied) she could just be op and need nerfs like everyone is saying.
2. Other marksman need to be buffed up to match her level.
3. Masteries might be just favoring her and they need to be changed.
4. The meta just favors her and her increase in winrate and playrate is a reflection of that.

Either way he never said anything definitive about what is coming in patch 6.24 and people are getting wayyy carried away pretending they are ignoring vayne being strong.

I can understand that it's best to keep an open mind from a design standpoint. You want what is best for the game. 

It's just that these boards tend to have a knee jerk reaction to marksmen. From the marksmen rework they've lead to some annoying issues, the two most highlighted being their superiority over melee (which is more of a ranged thing) and how they hurt diversity for everyone else (example being how they don't build Steraks anymore after it was nerfed, leaving melee champions with a weaker item while marksmen found new stuff). 


Honestly a lot of these complaints could be ill founded. Looking over at Reddit, I've noticed that they argue that it's a tank meta right now while people here could argue otherwise. 

And personally I believed that marksmen were too strong but would be nerfed to be brought down in power so assassins could feel like a bigger threat even with their increased windows. To hear that marksmen as a whole would potentially get buffed, well it lead to a bit of a panicked reaction. 

It's still the preseason and I know stuff is supposed to be crazy. But the preseason is shorter this year and some of these changes are starting to look scary from my point of view. 

And I usually love the crazy stuff in the preseason.

some champions have ben purposely nerfed out of the game for years until they got the neccessary changes. 

why isnt kallista treated the same way? she hasnt been benched for that long. nothing about her kit or what makes it broken has changed. what guarantees that shes not just going to dominate ranked play and the pro scene right away as soon as shes even close to relevant again?

since were at it. why isnt vayne treated the same way? has there actually ever been a period since her existence in this game when she wasnt either completely bonkers or mostly irrelevant? how do you plan on actually balancing that champion? because just buffing her counters and pushing her out will just once again flip the switch from absolute domination to played maybe once in a blue moon.

it was the same with jayce. we all knew what was going to happen as soon as hed become strong enough to be a regular pick again. and look what happened. hes completely dominating top lane again.

the same goes for fervor. buffing the mastery back to op is a terrible idea.

buffing bork back to its old op status is a terrible idea. especially with rageblade buffs in the same patch, and giant slayer being added since bork was this strong the last time.

why is this all being done in the same patch instead of one step at a time too?

> since were at it. why isnt vayne treated the same way? has there actually ever been a period since her existence in this game when she wasnt either completely bonkers or mostly irrelevant? how do you plan on actually balancing that champion? because just buffing her counters and pushing her out will just once again flip the switch from absolute domination to played maybe once in a blue moon.

Season 3 during the Assassin meta when Zed was pick or ban, She was always ignored in exchange for a longer range carry or the Juggermaw team comp

Season 4 she became a thing with the inital BOTRK, After that was nerfed she vanished due to champions like Corki getting their items buffed and Season 5 she was ignored in favor of Kalista

Season 6 she was ignored due to things like Armour pen MF/Lucian/Jhin 

Yes you can say "Oh shes been out of the main pick loop for nearly 4 full seasons so let her have her limelight" but the thing is that when she did come back into being a good pick she was never the monster she is now, Vaynes had to put in alot of work since it would take them 3-4 shots to kill squishies and 5--8 shots to kill a tank, where as now its 1-2 shots for a squishy and 3-4 shots for a tank

Not to mention even when she was out of the meta it wasn't like she was considered a troll pick, baring a small stint way back in 2014 where she was at a 46% win rate she's been floating between a 48-52% win rate for a long time which even riot themselves said is a good spot for any champion, problem is now her win rate is going towards 54% which in addition to her play rate (28%, the second highest play rate in the game besides Lee Sin)  Is why alarm bells are ringing

I think a bit of the problem with Vayne is how well she scales with items. Too often someone at my elo, I am Silver-low Gold, will pick Vayne, feed for the first 20-25 minutes, finish their 3rd item and suddenly the 0/15 Vayne is the biggest threat in the game. Her powerspike is overshadowing her "high skill floor" too much, a really bad Vayne can and will 1-3 shot almost anyone who isn't currently invulnerable once they hit that powerspike. Duskblade + IE + Shiv is just a really really strong combo on her because of how her Q works. They might not always win the game, which is why she doesn't appear as a problem when you look at winrate, but that is not what you should be looking at anyways. Its really annoying to stomp a bad vayne in lane only for her to come back and damn near 1 shot you 20 minutes later. There is nothing you can do about it, and Vayne has a lot of tools to deal with anyone coming at her.  

You wanted to extend the window of "burst" for assassins so you have time to react to their damage, but Vayne shoots you ONCE for 1600+ damage, no time to react to that. I think its only fair to give Vayne the same treatment, let her continue this insane damage if you want, but i think we need to be able to react to her damage.
winrate don't take low elo into account.

Thats true but you need to look at pick rate vs games played on champion vs winrate vs match-ups to get a real picture of a champions balance. My point was more that someone at low elo can pick up Vayne, farm for a bit until they can finish a few items, and suddenly the "high skill floor" that Vayne is suppose to have is almost gone. Even a bad Vayne can kill 2 or 3 people, specially at low elo where squishy carries consistently position incorrectly. If two really bad ADC's just stand still auto-attacking, Vayne has the advantage because her ability to deal 1500+ damage in a single shot.  

I wasn't necessarily saying that it is low elo people bringing her win rate down, i was saying just because she isn't winning doesn't mean she isn't a problem. So winrate shouldn't be a major factor in deciding her balance, need to look at how well she is performing and at what times she is spiking in power. I think she is currently hitting a spike too soon and too hard, specially since she is suppose to be a high skill champion.

The problem is marksmen itemization being too strong. Vayne here is just present because her Q buffs+ the change how her Q crits pushed her over the top, WAY over the top. Also the removal of flat arpen gives vayne enough windows to catch up again. Vayne is just guaranteed to be strong in a meta of assassins. Her power level otherwise isn't that much better than the other carries. Also, the removal of ghostblade as an ADC item sharply increased her power. She can now reliably duel enemy ADCs with the combo of a BF and shiv. Before you were taking a relatively large risk by trying to duel a lucian with a ghostblade, but not anymore. 

It's really a very complex situation. Ghostblade items got removed, but most carries aren't suit to be able to make a big splash in the early-mid game with crit build. Vayne with Q max can actually do that. Plus she can fight back against assassins, potentially being able to win a duel if she doesn't get 1 shot. 

So we're stuck with little to no variety in itemization, little to no variety in champion strength, and from what I've noticed, game impact is very inconsistent. I have seen a Twitch hard carry, literally 1v5, then the next game both carries aren't even 2nd in damage and are contributing little. 

More than ever exists the problem of the bot lane not being able to snowball by themselves.

It does not matter whether your thoughts on vayne or how the game should be balanced is right or wrong, you should always show respect towards those who work hard for this community, especially Meddler. Otherwise you're just a ranting nincompoop who knows nothing about game balance.
